comments: Or, composite numbers with smallest prime factor >= 5.Or, nonprime numbers n such that binomial(n+3, 3) mod n == 1. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Sep 30 2007Note that the primes > 3 are congruent to +-1 mod 6.This sequence differs from A067793 (composite n such that phi(n) > 2n/3) starting at 385. Numbers in this sequence but not in A067793 are 385, 455, 595, 665, 805, 1015, 1085, 1925, 2275, 2695, etc. See A069043. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 08 2008 and _Moshe Levin_, Nov 02 2011Intersection of A002808 and A007310. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 30 2012Composite numbers in A038179. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 29 2015
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Select[Range[1000], FactorInteger[#][[1,1]] >= 5 && ! PrimeQ[#] &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 19 2009 *)With[{nn=400},Select[Rest[Complement[Range[nn],Prime[Range[ PrimePi[ nn]]]]], MemberQ[ {1,5},Mod[#,6]]&]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 21 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a038509 n = a038509_list !! (n-1)a038509_list = [x | x <- a002808_list, gcd x 6 == 1]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 05 2014, Jun 30 2012(PARI) is(n)=gcd(n,6)==1 && !isprime(n) && n>7 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 20 2012
crossrefs: Cf. A069043, A067793 (composite n such that phi(n) > 2n/3).
author: _Jeff Burch_
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 19 2009
Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 31 2011, at the suggestion of _Gary Detlefs_
